snippet: California’s top earners are now facing a combined 51.9 percent federal and state income tax — the highest rate in the nation — a cause for grumbling and, maybe, an incentive to move.
abstract: California’s top earners are facing combined 51.9 percent federal and state income tax on earnings over $1 million, result of new tax-the-rich levies imposed by state and Congress; rates are highest in nation, and are causing some grumbling and perhaps incentive for many residents to move.
lead_paragraph: California’s top earners are now facing a combined 51.9 percent federal and state income tax — the highest rate in the nation — a cause for grumbling and, maybe, an incentive to move.

headline.seo: Millionaires Consider Leaving California Over Taxes
headline.main: Two-Tax Rise Tests Wealthy in California
headline.print_headline: Two-Tax Rise Tests Wealthy In California
